summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York reporting a call from a new potential victim who alleges she met Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black and was abused by Black. The attorney requests an investigator reach out to the individual to obtain a statement.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Identified by a potential victim as the person through whom she met Jeffrey Epstein and who allegedly abused her for some time starting approximately 12 years prior to 2020.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The potential victim reported meeting him through Leon Black, connecting him to the alleged abuse.

connections.description: A potential victim reported meeting Epstein through Black, indicating a social or professional connection between them.
The potential victim alleges that Leon Black abused her for some time starting approximately 12 years prior to 2020.

events.title: Alleged Abuse by Leon Black Begins
events.description: A potential victim reports that Leon Black abused her for some time, starting approximately 12 years before March 2020, when she was 25 years old.

events.title: Report of New Potential Victim
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney receives a call at their office from an individual reporting she was abused by Leon Black after meeting him through Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: A new potential victim contacted the U.S. Attorney's office in March 2020, alleging abuse by financier Leon Black.
The victim reported meeting Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black, establishing a connection between Black and Epstein.
The alleged abuse by Black started approximately 12 years prior (around 2008) when the victim was 25 years old.
The Assistant U.S. Attorney did not gather detailed facts but requested an investigator contact the victim for a formal statement.
The victim's identity and contact information are mentioned in the email but are redacted in the provided text.
